intro: Pituranthos chloranthus, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and hairy, narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in full sun, often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include small, clustered inflorescences and a low-growing, herbaceous habit. Pituranthos chloranthus is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
